alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lawrence, west central Mingo and southwestern Wayne Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cisco, or 7 miles northwest of Salyersville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Blaine, Dunlow, Ulysses, Martha, Charley, Hode, Kermit, Gallup, Crum, Clifford and Glenhayes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and southern and western West Virginia.
